comments:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a Java Project with a runnable class in it.
2. Create a basic project and add a Jar file into it.
3. Open the Launch Configuration dialog and create a Java Application launch 
for the main() class created in step 1.
4. Go to the Source tab and Add the Jar file created in step 2 as an archive.
5. Run - everything should be fine.
6. Delete the basic project and its contents.
7. Click the Run icon again (relaunch) and you'll receive the error listed 
below because of the bad source location.
8. Try to open up the launch configuration dialog. You'll receive a similar 
error that is coming from the same code.

This problem is easy enough to work around for the Java launch configuration - 
just delete the config and create another one. However, it's a blocking 
problem for launch configurations that have the public attribute set to false.

Once the project has been deleted, does the PRIVATE config remain useful? If 
not, could it be deleted? I.e. could your tool have a resource listener that 
notes a relevant project was deleted and then clean up after itself?

(Looking at the code we have an obvious NPE here, that should be fixed, but 
just wondering if there is an alternate workaround).

Yes, although this doesn't sound like a minor addition to me. Some issues:

1) If we created a listener for project deletion, wouldn't it then have to 
look for launches of this specific type and then load the source containers to 
see if the launch was affected, thus hitting this exact code? Would a "pre-
delete" listener be ok here?

2) What if the project is deleted before our plugin is loaded, and hence the 
listener hasn't been added yet?

Fixed in 3.1 stream. 

Changed ArchiveSourceContainer to subclass AbstractSourceContainer and 
maintain a delegate external archive (rather than subclass the 
ExternalArchiveSourceContainer). Since the ExternalArchiveSourceContainer 
requires a file name to work (via its constructor), it was awkward to maintain 
ArchiveSourceContainer as a subclass, when there was no corresponing external 
file. New implementation creates a delegate external archive source container 
and delegates init/dispose/find to the delegate, when it exists.

Created an attachment (id=15125)
patch (3.1)

Patch that I will merge into 3.0.1 stream

Please verify, Luc. Note that I filed the following bugs, which I discovered: 
bug 76119 and bug 76121.
Fix was released to 3.0.1.1 maintenance stream/build.
This fix is in the 3.0.2 maintenance build.
